title: Graphing motion on an inclined plane with friction

content.question: A box is sent up a ramp with an initial speed of <math alttext="v sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, as shown in the figure above. The box stops before reaching the top of the ramp and then slides back down the ramp. There is friction between the box and the ramp. If the positive direction is up the ramp, which of the following graphs best represents the velocity <math alttext="v" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of the box as a function of time <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> as it travels along the ramp?

choices.label: The figure shows a graph of a line in the first and fourth quadrants of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis is labeled v. A point labeled v sub 0 is located near the top of the vertical axis. The line begins at the point labeled v sub 0 on the vertical axis and slants downward and to the right, crossing the horizontal axis at a point slightly less than halfway along the axis. It continues downward and to the right until it ends far below the horizontal axis and far to the right of the vertical axis.

The figure shows a graph consisting of two line segments in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t and the vertical axis is labeled v.
